protocol.title: protocol of the next level layer. For example, this may be TCP, UDP or ICMP among others.

source.name: source
source.title: source address field that lets the receiver know where the packet came from.

target.name: target
target.title: If a packet matches the rule, the target specifies what should be done with it.

computerInfo.title: A consolidated object of system and operating system properties

features.title: Information about Windows Server roles, role services, and features that are available for installation and installed on a specified server.

windows.title: Windows-specific resource to get operating system details

conversionStatus.name: conversionStatus
conversionStatus.title: Indicates the status of the encryption or decryption on the volume

encryptionMethod.name: encryptionMethod
encryptionMethod.title: Encryption algorithm and key size used on the volume

lockStatus.name: lockStatus
lockStatus.title: Indicates whether the contents of the volume are accessible from Windows
lockStatus.desc: 0 = full contents of the volume are accessible 1 = all or a portion of the contents of the volume are not accessible

persistentVolumeID.name: persistentVolumeID
persistentVolumeID.title: Persistent identifier for the volume on this system

protectionStatus.name: protectionStatus
protectionStatus.title: Status of the volume, whether or not BitLocker is protecting the volume
protectionStatus.desc: 0 = Protection Off 1 = Protection On 2 = Protection Unknown

version.name: version
version.title: BitLocker Full Volume Encryption metadata version of the volume

installed.name: installed
installed.title: Flag indicates whether the feature is installed

name.name: name
name.title: Command IDs of role, role service, or feature

profiles.name: profiles
profiles.title: Settings that apply to the per-profile configurations of the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security

allowInboundRules.name: allowInboundRules
allowInboundRules.title: If this is true, administrators will be able to create firewall rules which allow unsolicited inbound traffic to be accepted if this is false, such rules will be ignored

allowLocalFirewallRules.name: allowLocalFirewallRules
allowLocalFirewallRules.title: Determines whether local firewall rules should be merged into the effective policy along with group policy settings

allowLocalIPsecRules.name: allowLocalIPsecRules
allowLocalIPsecRules.title: Determines whether local IPsec rules should be merged into the effective policy along with rules from group policy

allowUnicastResponseToMulticast.name: allowUnicastResponseToMulticast
allowUnicastResponseToMulticast.title: Whether to allow unicast responses to multicast traffic

allowUserApps.name: allowUserApps
allowUserApps.title: Whether to respect user allowed applications created in the legacy firewall

allowUserPorts.name: allowUserPorts
allowUserPorts.title: Whether to respect globally opened ports created in the legacy firewall

enableStealthModeForIPsec.name: enableStealthModeForIPsec
enableStealthModeForIPsec.title: Whether to use stealth mode for IPsec-protected traffic

enabled.name: enabled
enabled.title: Whether the firewall is enabled on this profile

logFileName.name: logFileName
logFileName.title: Filename in which to store the firewall log

logIgnored.name: logIgnored
logIgnored.title: Whether to log an event when rules are ignored

logMaxSizeKilobytes.name: logMaxSizeKilobytes
logMaxSizeKilobytes.title: Maximum size the log file can reach before being rotated

notifyOnListen.name: notifyOnListen
notifyOnListen.title: If true, users will be notified when an application listens on a port that is close

action.name: action
action.title: Specifies the action to take on traffic that matches this rule

direction.name: direction
direction.title: Specifies which direction of traffic to match with this rule

displayGroup.name: displayGroup
displayGroup.title: The group that this rule belongs to

edgeTraversalPolicy.name: edgeTraversalPolicy
edgeTraversalPolicy.title: Specifies how this firewall rule will handle edge traversal cases
edgeTraversalPolicy.desc: values: block (0), allow (1), defer to user (2), defer to app (3)

enabled.name: enabled
enabled.title: Indicates whether this rule is administratively enabled or disabled

enforcementStatus.name: enforcementStatus
enforcementStatus.title: If this object is retrieved from the ActiveStore

instanceID.name: instanceID
instanceID.title: A string that uniquely identifies this instance within the PolicyStore

localOnlyMapping.name: localOnlyMapping
localOnlyMapping.title: Whether to group UDP packets into conversations based only upon the local address and port

looseSourceMapping.name: looseSourceMapping
looseSourceMapping.title: Whether to group UDP packets into conversations based upon the local address, local port, and remote port

policyStoreSource.name: policyStoreSource
policyStoreSource.title: Contains the path to the policy store where this rule originally came from

policyStoreSourceType.name: policyStoreSourceType
policyStoreSourceType.title: Describes the type of policy store where this rule originally came from

primaryStatus.name: primaryStatus
primaryStatus.title: PrimaryStatus provides a high level status value

description.name: description
description.title: Type of hotfix eg. `Update` or `Security Update`

installedOn.name: installedOn
installedOn.title: Date the hotfix was installed on

windows.security.health.title: Returns the health for Windows security provider

baseurl.title: URL where the repodata directory of a repository is located
